post: How did Shermans March to the Sea support emancipation during the Civil War? In this episode of Scholar Talks, BRI Senior Fellow Tony Williams sits down with historian Bennett Parten to discuss themes from Somewhere Toward Freedom. They explore the intersection of military strategy and the fight for freedom, the choices enslaved individuals made, and the marchs lasting impact on Reconstruction. Watch now,  https://lnkd.in/eCeZQGbr.  #BRI  #BillofRightsInstitute  #ScholarTalk

The Bill of Rights Institute is honored to partner with Konica Minolta Business Solutions U. S. A., Inc. to support 50,000 civic and history students. Power of the Printed Word is a funding and printing initiative to enable BRI to provide pocket copies of the U. S. Constitution to teachers and students nationwide. We are extremely honored and proud to support The Bill of Rights Institute in their mission to drive high-quality civic education, and excited to help bring these important pieces of our history to students,  said Jason Dizzine, Vice President, Portfolio Management and Planning, Konica Minolta. Konica Minolta Business Solutions U. S. A. Inc.'s (Konica Minolta) journey started more than 150 years ago, with a vision to see and do things differently. To learn more about Konica Minolta and the partnership with the Bill of Rights Institute, visit  https://lnkd.in/e54jP73a.  #BillofRightsInstitute  #BRI  #PowerofthePrintedWord

📰 Konica Minolta and Bill of Rights Institute Partner to Support 50,000 Civics and History Students: Will Help Provide Pocket Constitutions to Classrooms Throughout the United States Read all about it:  https://ow.ly/IFva50VkvH4

The Honoring Service series explores civic virtue and responsibility by highlighting the service of our nations veterans. In this episode, former Army Aviator Dean Wegner joins Vice President of Civic Leadership Development Gerald Gangaram to reflect on his time at West Point, Army Ranger training and career in aviation. Wegners experiences taught him leadership skills, grit, and perseverance to overcome challenges, both in the Army and now as an entrepreneur. Wegner is the founder and CEO of Authentically American, an American-made premium apparel company. The heart of their mission is their passion for creating American jobs, which Wegner attributes to his calling to serve the nation. Watch the video, now  https://lnkd.in/exq6Kwnv Learn more about the Wright Brothers diligence in pioneering flight by exploring the lesson, It is a Fact Man Cant Fly: The Wright Brothers at Kitty Hawk and Diligence.  https://lnkd.in/etUF6QCW  #BillofRightsInstitute  #BRI  #HonoringService

Happy St. Patrick's Day from the Bill of Rights Institute! Did you know several U. S. Presidents have Irish roots? From Teddy Roosevelt to Joe Biden and more, Irish American presidents have shaped U. S. history in profound ways. Today, we celebrate the history of Irish American presidents on American democracy and leadership. Check out our playlist on Irish American presidents now!  https://lnkd.in/eD_dinxK  #billofrightsinstitute  #BRI  #StPatricksDay

Attention all educators, mentors, and community leaders! The  #FloridaMyImpactChallenge, hosted by the Bill of Rights Institute and University of Central Florida Florida Joint Center for Citizenship & Lou Frey Instiute, is now accepting submissions from students aged 13-19 who are actively engaged in service, volunteerism, or entrepreneurship within their communities. This is a fantastic opportunity for young social entrepreneurs to showcase their impactful projects and compete for substantial prizes! Participants stand a chance to win: -$2,000 Florida First Prize -$1,500 Florida Second Prize -$1,000 Florida Third Prize -$500 Florida Fourth Prize -5 $250 Pitch Competition Prizes Submissions are open until March 30, 2025, 11:59 PM. All Florida-based entrants will be invited to present their projects in person at the Civics Fair on April 5, 2025, providing a platform to network and gain recognition for their efforts. Encourage the young changemakers in your network to apply and make a difference! For more details and application guidelines, visit the official website:  https://lnkd.in/e2ZyW-hR  #FloridaMyImpactChallenge  #YouthEntrepreneurs  #CivicEngagement  #BillofRightsInstitute

What does it mean to be a responsible citizen? See how students will showcase how they are making a real difference in their communities at our MyImpact Challenge State Civic Fair at the University of Central Florida April 5th. From service projects to civic leadership, these students exemplify our nations virtues. Are you a Florida-based student who should showcase your service project? Apply by April 1, 2025. Learn more about the fair,  https://lnkd.in/eQdnNdgC.

How can students practice the skills of citizenship right now? MyImpact Challenge gives students a robust understanding of the role of the citizen in civil society by exploring the pillars of citizenship: entrepreneurship, charity, and government. It is developed with multiple implementations in mind, including classrooms, afterschool programs, and social clubs. With original background essays, guided resources, and rubrics, students will write a research report on the impacts of these different efforts, then develop and implement a project that exemplifies everyday citizenship. View the MyImpact Challenge lessons now  https://lnkd.in/eRw-N5YT
